Decision support with Excel

End of Bachelor project in which I had to work with another student with Sales data provided by a real company. It’s a quite small company with only 10 employees or so and their data management wasn’t exemplary. All their records were stored in excel sheets and not well-organized, with missing data, errors, etc...

We did work really-hard for about one month and the result had shown to the company that they could do way better in terms of data management.

Main screen
Clients dimension
Geography dimension
Interactive map
Activity sector dimension
❮ ❯

As you can see from the images, we splitted the data analysis into 4 main axes: time, space, activity sector and statistics. Macros (interactions) where done using Visual Basic and the data wharehouse was a MS Access database.
The most challenging part of this project was indoubtedly the map on which we spent a lot of time .

This wasn’t the most exciting project I ever had as I am not a big fan of excel but I found it quite satisfying to see how much a proper data management can simplify the work of a company, even with this simple tool.
